job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: Job ResponsibilitiesDesign and implement end-to-end data analytics and automation solutions using a variety of digital technologiesIdentify complex problems, develop, and deploy novel prototypes and algorithms to solve themConducts studies to support product or application developmentCollaborate cross-functional with business units and functional units to deliver Data Science initiatives and to assist in developing the architecture of digital business processes. This may include augmented reality, predictive and prescriptive maintenance, no-touch order management, platform economy, digital avatar, control systems, robotics applicationsIdentify how data science and Artificial Intelligence can be applied to improve, optimize, and expand Company’s infrastructure across a variety of business and functional domains, with emphasis on long-term and Digital RoadmapScan technology landscape for relevant Data Science technologies and Artificial Intelligence applicationsCollaborate to develop Digital Literacy of the enterprise through training citizen data scientists and citizen data analysts. Required Skills & QualificationsQUALIFICATIONS Demonstrated expertise in mathematical modeling and in the development and application of descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics to deliver insights from structured, unstructured, and semi-structured data sets with a particular focus on use cases pertaining to chemicals manufacturing and discrete products manufacturing industryExperience in Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Neural Networks, Machine Vision, Statistical modeling, time series and frequency analysisExperience in mining large sets of data, designing ETL flows, analyzing transactional, and real-time electronic dataExperience in data quality analysis, data cleansing, and data engineeringCompetency in the use of one or more analytics software languages (e.g. Python, R, MATLAB, IDEA, SPSS), distributed computational frameworks (Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark), big data environments (Databricks, Cloudera, AWS EMR), machine learning packages (TensorFlow, Pytorch, Theano etc.) and data engineering frameworks (Hive, SQL, Impala)Experience in the use of deep learning tools to train a variety of neural network architectures (e.g., multilayer perceptron, convolutional networks, transfer learned networks) to develop effective predictive modelsExperience in helping to establish product requirements, gather data, design experiments, create models, build software and analytics tools, and communicate findingsGood understanding of distributed computing and efficient algorithm designExperience with integration techniques, including model regularization, pruning, quantization, bias/vulnerability assessments and performance, latency, accuracy, size of model, throughput, energy efficiency and reproducibility (PLASTER) criteriaFamiliarity with machine learning as applied to industrial operational data, e-commerce data, customer order fulfillment data, and ability to recognize inconsistencies in data or interpretationExperience in productionizing machine learning models and have good understanding of machine learning model life cycleExperience answering big picture questions by framing the question, turning it into an analytical plan, executing and communicating to stakeholdersExperience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidanceStrong sense of ownership combined with collaborative approach to overcoming challenges and influencing organizational cultural changeBackground in manufacturing process industry preferred.   EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE8+ years of data science experienceMasters in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Data SciencePhD preferred
